definition: to keep sth confidential/to maintain secrecy
Bulgaria/Bulgarian/abbr. for 保加利亞|保加利亚[Bao3 jia1 li4 ya4]
to defend/to protect/to keep/to guarantee/to ensure/civil administration unit in the baojia 保甲[bao3 jia3] system (old)
surname Mi/name of an ancient state

sentences.english: Drache to confidential action content, therefore has not to clarify in this matter.
sentences.chinese: 卓凯为了保密行动内容，故一直没有就此事作出澄清。

sentences.english: "And also this affair must be discreet, " Kugelmass continued.
sentences.chinese: “然后同样这次外遇必须保密，”库马思继续。

sentences.english: He said some secrecy was important to avoid detection by the two governments.
sentences.chinese: 他表示为避免两国政府侦查发现，保密工作很重要。

sentences.english: I wanted mother's present to be secret, but my sister let the cat out of the bag.
sentences.chinese: 给母亲的礼物我原想保密的，可是妹妹却露了马脚。

sentences.english: The Anti-monopoly Authority shall maintain the confidentiality of the person making such report.
sentences.chinese: 反垄断执法机构应当为举报人保密。

sentences.english: Taiwanese law requires all information be secret during an investigation.
sentences.chinese: 台湾法律规定，所有信息在调查过程中都必须保密。

sentences.english: Embargoes lead to more total coverage than exclusives.
sentences.chinese: 保密协议比独家报道的覆盖面更加广泛。

sentences.english: All applications will be placed in our Talent Pool and handled with strictest confidence, non-returnable.
sentences.chinese: 所有简历均会存入集团人才库，保密处理，恕不退还。

sentences.english: Any third-party vendor so used has agreed to protect the confidentiality of information provided by VCES.
sentences.chinese: 任何第三方卖主习以为常答应保密资料器件。

sentences.english: WHAT DOES THE CURRENT STATE SECRETS LAW COVER?
sentences.chinese: 当前保密法涵盖哪些方面？

sentences.english: NDA agreement MUST be signed before proceeding with anything.
sentences.chinese: 协议必须签署保密协议之前，任何意外。

sentences.english: All information provided will be kept strictly confidential and used for selection purposes only by the adjudication panel.
sentences.chinese: 所有资料将严格保密，并只供评选团作甄选之用。

sentences.english: Switzerland has benefited from its bank secrecy laws.
sentences.chinese: 瑞士由于其银行保密法，因此选择了后一种途径。

sentences.english: The company's regime of secrecy was engineered by Jobs himself.
sentences.chinese: 这间公司的保密制度就是由Jobs亲自建立的。

sentences.english: Confidentiality may be particularly stringentin this case.
sentences.chinese: 这样的话，保密性显得尤为重要。

definition: lit. to guard one's mouth like a closed bottle (idiom); tight-lipped/reticent/not breathing a word
to conceal/to hide (a taboo subject)/to cover up the truth
to make known to the masses (idiom); to publicize widely/to let the world know
to withhold information/to keep sth secret
